intro: Taxillus delavayi var. barbatus, commonly known as the Indian milk vine, is a parasitic plant that belongs to the Loranthaceae family. It is characterized by its green, leafy stems that often grow on the branches of host trees, such as mango and neem. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries are red or orange when mature and contain several seeds. Taxillus delavayi var. barbatus is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it plays a role in the ecological interactions of its host plants.
